isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SPICER 13-INCH (310 MM) AND 14-INCH (350 MM) ANGLE-RING SINGLE PLATE PUSH-TYPE CLUTCH - OPERATION

svcproc.title: OPERATION
svcproc.para: The Spicer Angle-Ring clutch is a push-type release clutch. Pressing on the clutch pedal moves the release bearing forward (toward the engine flywheel), and into pressure contact with the clutch levers. When these levers are pressed, they retract the pressure plate from contact with the driven disc assembly to disengage the clutch.

Releasing the clutch pedal engages the clutch by moving the release bearing rearward (away from the engine flywheel). The belleville springs exert pressure on the pressure plate, so that the driven disc "locks up" between the friction surfaces of the pressure plate and the flywheel.

note.para: This clutch design has less bearing release load than other design clutches of the same sizes. Required pedal effort is low.
